magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

description.value:
At 2nd level, you choose to identify with a circle of druids, such as the Circle of the Land.

Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

Druid Circles

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.WsdWAszS0oepW5SZ]{Circle of Dreams}

Druids who are members of the Circle of Dreams hail from regions that have strong ties to the Feywild and its dreamlike realms.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.cJUVrjefuW9qK9Ba]{Circle of Spores}

Druids of the Circle of Spores find beauty in decay. They see within mold and other fungi the ability to transform lifeless material into abundant, albeit somewhat strange, life.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.MC0q06gMrBZfCleC]{Circle of Stars}

The Circle of Stars allows druids to draw on the power of starlight. These druids have tracked heavenly patterns since time immemorial, discovering secrets hidden amid the constellations.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.PbxrSTRdL0tS47R9]{Circle of the Land}

The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.1JjTiQfjI7MYWB1x]{Circle of the Moon}

Druids of the Circle of the Moon are fierce guardians of the wilds. Their order gathers under the full moon to share news and trade warnings.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.hrnTqKhAJQCvBsH7]{Circle of the Shephard}

Druids of the Circle of the Shepherd commune with the spirits of nature, especially the spirits of beasts and the fey, and call to those spirits for aid.

@Compendium[5e-complete.5e-subclasses.1aauNtfl2OWaXItT]{Circle of Wildfire}

Druids within the Circle of Wildfire understand that destruction is sometimes the precursor of creation, such as when a forest fire promotes later growth.
